comments.body: This (lines 247-260) can be refactored into the superclass and used in both avg and max pooling.
In the interest of pushing dnn 1.0 PR's I have added a ToDo to fix this soon. I will take up the AR to  modify it on later PRs.
Does this mean you won't support forward inference with other data types (int32, float32, bfloat16, etc)?
For now we support only int8 and float32. Other data type support may come later on.

Could you please add a comment saying that `prop_kind::forward_training` is for the forward primitive inside the backward primitive? It feels weird to see the word `forward_training` inside a backward op.

Also, since you pass `prop_kind` here, do you need to change `prop_kind::forward_training` in the line below to `bwdParams.prop_kind`?
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/ef4613c96592fe5fd74ee62594b5d98f62c73d56/tensorflow/core/kernels/mkl_pooling_ops_common.cc#L160

Could you please put all these memory::dims in a struct and add a helper function PoolParamsToDims to populate them. Use it in the functions below as well as much as possible. There's a lot of duplicated boilerplate.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +485,489 @@
      // Get src/filter/stride/padding information
      memory::dims src_dims = dnn_shape_input.IsMklTensor()
                            ? dnn_shape_input.GetSizesAsMklDnnDims()
                            : TFShapeToMklDnnDimsInNCHW(input_tensor.shape(),
